card_answer:
###An accident is unexpected, and may cause some trouble.

---

_He damaged the car in an accident._

###An astronaut is a person who goes into outer space.

---

_The astronaut was walking on the moon._

###A person who is awake is not asleep.

---

_Sometimes, I lay awake in bed because I am not tired._

###Courage is the feeling of not being afraid.

---

_The man had the courage to touch the lion._

###To float is to move on top of water without sinking.

---

_The boy’s toy boat floated in the pool._

###To grant something is to allow someone to have it.

---

_The teacher granted us a break after studying hard all day._

###Gravity is the force that makes things fall to Earth.

---

_There is no gravity in space._

###A jewel is a beautiful stone that is worth a lot of money.

---

_A diamond is one of the most expensive jewels in the world._

###A miner is a person who works in a mine.

---

_The miner was looking for gold._

###A mineral is a type of substance found in the Earth.

---

_Rocks are made up of different kinds of minerals._

###To participate is to be active and do something.

---

_The students participated in the school play._

###Permission means the act of allowing some action.

---

_I have permission to drive my mom’s car._

###To pour a liquid means to make it come out of a container.

---

_I poured some milk into my sister’s cup._

###A raw material is natural and has not been processed.

---

_The company dumped raw sewage into the river._

###A satellite is a machine sent into space to get information.

---

_The satellite was traveling around the Earth._

###The scale of something is its size, especially when it is very large.

---

_I was surprised by the scale of the buildings in the downtown area._

###To skip something is to not do it.

---

_He skipped work to get more sleep._

###To stretch is to make your arms or legs reach out.

---

_She stretched her body before exercising._

###A telescope is a tool people use to look at the stars.

---

_With a telescope, you can see the moon and stars easily._

###An underground action happens below the surface of the Earth.

---

_Subway trains travel underground._

###An alarm is something that warns people of danger.

---

_When the students heard the fire alarm, they left the building._

###To arrest someone means to catch that person for doing something bad.

---

_The man was arrested for breaking the law._

###An award is a prize for doing something well.

---

_He got an award for having the best grades in class._

###A breed is a group of animals within a species.

---

_I like small dog breeds, such as terriers._

###A bucket is a round container to put things in.

---

_I filled the bucket with water._

###A contest is a game or a race.

---

_The girls had a contest to see who could jump higher._

###To convict means to prove that someone did a bad thing.

---

_He was convicted of the crime and sent to jail._

###A festival is an event that is held to celebrate a particular thing.

---

_I heard the song at the music festival in London._

###A garage is the part of a house where people put their cars.

---

_My car does not get dirty because I keep it in the garage._

###A journalist is a person who writes news stories.

---

_The journalist took notes for a story he was writing._

###A pup is a young dog.

---

_All the girl wanted for her birthday was a pup._

###To qualify is to have or do things that are needed for something.

---

_He qualified to go to the final match by beating the opponent._

###To repair something is to fix it.

---

_I repaired the flat tire on my car._

###To resume something means to start it again after taking a break.

---

_I put the newspaper down to eat breakfast. Then, I resumed reading._

###To rob is to take property by using force.

---

_A thief has robbed me of my passport._

###To slip means to slide and fall down.

---

_The man slipped on the wet floor._

###Somewhat means to some degree, but not to a large degree.

---

_James was somewhat upset when he had to move heavy boxes._

###A stable thing will not move, change, or fall over.

---

_The chair is stable. Its legs are strong._

###A tissue is a soft piece of paper people use to wipe their noses.

---

_There was a box of tissue on the table._

###A yard is the ground just outside of a house.

---

_The girls jumped rope in the yard._

###The best person or thing is better than all the others.

---

_I got the best score on the math test._

###A card is a small piece of plastic or paper used to buy or use things.

---

_Adam used his library card to borrow a book._

###A crowd is a large group of people who are together in one place.

---

_The crowd waved to the camera._

###A day is a period of twenty-four hours, beginning at midnight.

---

_There are two more days until the weekend._

###A dish is a type of food that is cooked in a particular way.

---

_My favorite dish at the restaurant is chicken curry._

###An easy action is not difficult to do.

---

_Karen is happy because her English homework is easy._

###To experience is to do or see something or have something happen to you.

---

_Going to the concert was the best thing I’ve ever experienced._

###A hotel is a place where people stay overnight when they are traveling.

---

_This family is staying at their favorite hotel._

###An hour is sixty minutes.

---

_The man waited for the train for over an hour._

###Light is a form of energy or brightness that makes it possible to see something.

---

_I will turn on the light so that you can see._

###A market is a place where people buy and sell products or food.

---

_I go to the market every weekend to buy vegetables._

###To plan is to think about and arrange the details of something you want to do.

---

_It’s Sam’s turn to plan the company party._

###The price is the amount of money needed to pay for something.

---

_Julie is checking the price of a sweater._

###A short thing is not long or not tall.

---

_The days are short in the winter._

###To shop is to visit places where goods are sold in order to look at and buy things.

---

_Tom decided to shop for groceries on his way home._

###A station is a place where buses and trains stop for passengers.

---

_This man is waiting at the train station._

###To surprise is to cause something that is unexpected.

---

_His parents decided to surprise him with a puppy._

###A system is a group of related parts that move or work together.

---

_This device controls the building’s heating system._

###A taxi is a car and driver that you pay to take you somewhere.

---

_Gary drives a taxi, so he knows the roads very well._

###Two is the word for the number 2.

---

_Two friends study together at the coffee shop._

###A bath is the act of sitting in a tub of water in order to get clean.

---

_After playing in the dirt, the boy took a bath._

###To bend is to move something so it is not straight.

---

_Lee bent over and picked up the paper on the ground._

###To chew is to break up food by using the mouth and teeth.

---

_I always chew my food carefully before swallowing it._

###A disabled person has a physical problem that makes some activities difficult.

---

_The disabled man used a wheelchair to move around._

###A fantastic thing is really good.

---

_The student did a fantastic job on his project and got an award._

###Fiction is a story that is not true.

---

_I enjoy reading works of fiction because they are very entertaining._

###A flag is a piece of colored cloth that represents something.

---

_Our country has a beautiful flag._

###To inspect is to look at something carefully.

---

_The mechanic inspected our car to see if it had any problems._

###A journal is a type of magazine that deals with an academic subject.

---

_Mi-young was busy working on an article for an art journal._

###A liquid is a substance that is neither solid nor gas.

---

_Water is the most important liquid for life._

###To marvel at something is to feel surprise and interest in it.

---

_We marveled at her excellent piano playing._

###To overcome a problem is to successfully fix it.

---

_She overcame her shyness and spoke in front of the class._

###To recall something is to remember it.

---

_She was trying to recall what she had told her friend._

###To regret something is to wish that it hadn’t happened.

---

_I regret that I was mean to my sister._

###A soul is a person’s spirit.

---

_Some people believe that the soul lives after the body dies._

###Sufficient shows that something is enough, in quality or quantity.

---

_After eating a sufficient amount of food, I left the table._

###Surgery is medical treatment involving a doctor cutting into a body.

---

_I needed surgery to repair my leg after the accident._

###A tough thing is difficult.

---

_The man passed his driving test even though it was very tough._

###A tube is a pipe through which water or air passes.

---

_The pile of tubes was going to be put in the ground._

###The value of something is what it is worth.

---

_Your love for me has greater value than gold._

###An atom is the smallest unit of a substance.

---

_A molecule consists of a combination of two or more atoms._

###A beautiful thing is good to look at.

---

_There was a beautiful sunset._

###Breadth is the distance from one side to the other side of something.

---

_The breadth of the northern wall of the house is twenty meters._

###A comet is an object in space made of ice and rock with a tail of glowing dust.

---

_Comets take many decades to complete an orbit around a star._

###To cover something is to put things over it.

---

_The Earth was covered with clouds._

###Despair is the feeling of having no hope.

---

_After we lost the big account, our salespeople were filled with despair._

###To form is to make or to shape something.

---

_They formed a new government._

###A fragment is a small part of something.

---

_After the light broke, there were fragments of glass to clean up._

###A galaxy is an extremely large collection of star systems.

---

_Our solar system is located in the outer area of our galaxy._

###Gloom is a state of almost complete darkness or sadness.

---

_In the gloom of the morning, it was difficult to see the boat on the lake._

###Something large is very big.

---

_I was frightened by a large bird._

###The moon is an object that travels around our Earth.

---

_The moon looks beautiful tonight._

###To radiate means to send out energy or heat.

---

_The heat from the fireplace radiated throughout the room._

###To roam means to move around without a plan or purpose.

---

_All day, the cows roamed around the field eating grass._

###A solitary thing is lonely or the only one.

---

_The only thing in the room was a solitary chair._

###The spectrum is the full range of color ranging from red to violet.

---

_You can see the entire spectrum in a rainbow._

###A sphere is a three-dimensional round shape, like a ball.

---

_The balloons were inflated into a variety of colorful spheres._

###A star is a bright shining thing in the night sky.

---

_The stars come out at night._

###Status is the position of something or someone in relation to others.

---

_She had achieved the status of being the smartest girl in the class._

###Something ugly is not good to look at.

---

_It was an ugly sight._
